title: How to Build a Vacuum Former

steps.title: Measure and draw your guidelines.
steps.content: Measure and draw your guidelines. On 3/4 inch plywood, draw three squares, 5 inches on a side. Draw another, smaller 4 inch square centered inside each square.

steps.title: Cut along the inner squares on all three frame pieces.
steps.content: Cut along the inner squares on all three frame pieces.

steps.title: Cut along the outer guidelines to finish each frame piece.
steps.content: Cut along the outer guidelines to finish each frame piece.

steps.title: Build the main box by stacking and gluing the three frame pieces together.
steps.content: Build the main box by stacking and gluing the three frame pieces together.

steps.title: Clamp all four sides of the box and allow the glue to dry.
steps.content: Clamp all four sides of the box and allow the glue to dry.

steps.title: Drill a hole on one side using the hole saw so the vacuum hose (or adapter) will fit snugly.
steps.content: Drill a hole on one side using the hole saw so the vacuum hose (or adapter) will fit snugly.

steps.title: Measure and draw outside frame.
steps.content: Measure and draw outside frame. On the 5mm MDF, draw a 5 inch square.

steps.title: Measure and draw a grid.
steps.content: Measure and draw a grid. Start in from a corner at 0.5 inches from each side, draw straight vertical lines every 2/3 inches for a total of 7 lines. Repeat the pattern for horizontal lines creating an intersecting grid pattern.

steps.title: Drill 3/32 inch holes at each intersection.
steps.content: Drill 3/32 inch holes at each intersection.

steps.title: Cut the final platen out of the MDF along the outside frame lines drawn earlier.
steps.content: Cut the final platen out of the MDF along the outside frame lines drawn earlier.

steps.title: Glue the platen to the top of the former box created in the previous step, clamping all four sides until the glue dries.
steps.content: Glue the platen to the top of the former box created in the previous step, clamping all four sides until the glue dries.

steps.title: Measure and draw cutting guidelines.
steps.content: Measure and draw cutting guidelines. On the 5mm MDF, draw a 5 inch by 9 inch rectangle.

steps.title: Cut frame from MDF.
steps.content: Cut frame from MDF.

steps.title: Glue this final piece to the bottom of the vacuum former box, clamping the two flush sides until the it is fully dried.
steps.content: Glue this final piece to the bottom of the vacuum former box, clamping the two flush sides until the it is fully dried.

steps.title: Measure and draw guidelines.
steps.content: Measure and draw guidelines. On the 5mm MDF, draw two 7.5 inch squares Centered inside each square draw another, 5.5 inch square.

steps.title: Cut out the inner square of each frame piece.
steps.content: Cut out the inner square of each frame piece.

steps.title: Cut along the outer guideline to finish the frame pieces.
steps.content: Cut along the outer guideline to finish the frame pieces.

steps.title: Mount the box.
steps.content: Mount the box. Set the box on a sturdy table. Using the clams / quick clamps, firmly clamp the box to the table.

steps.title: Attach the vacuum.
steps.content: Attach the vacuum. Firmly push the vacuum hose or adapter into the hole on the side of the former.

steps.title: Gather your materials.
steps.content: Gather your materials. Cut your desired thermoplastic into 6 inch square sheets. Choose or 3d print shapes to be formed.

steps.title: Place the objects to be molded on the platen (top).
steps.content: Place the objects to be molded on the platen (top). Take care to space the part around the holes to maintain clean edges.

steps.title: Clamp the thermoplastic sheet between the frame pieces with the binder clips.
steps.content: Clamp the thermoplastic sheet between the frame pieces with the binder clips.

steps.title: Hold frame with grips to keep heat away from your hands.
steps.content: Hold frame with grips to keep heat away from your hands.

steps.title: Heat plastic using slow, even motion with the heat gun.
steps.content: Heat plastic using slow, even motion with the heat gun. Keep going until until the plastic sags about 1.5 to 2 inches

steps.title: Turn on the vacuum.
steps.content: Turn on the vacuum.

steps.title: Lower the heated thermoplastic onto former over objects.
steps.content: Lower the heated thermoplastic onto former over objects.

steps.title: Continue to heat the thermoplastic around edges and fine details to ensure a clean mold.
steps.content: Continue to heat the thermoplastic around edges and fine details to ensure a clean mold.
